name: PREMIUM TOUR BERNABÉU
info: PREMIUM Tour Bernabéu</br>This product includes:</br></br>A guided visit led by an Official Real Madrid CF Guide. (English and Spanish)</br>Access to the Real Madrid C.F. Museum.</br>Photo with the European Cup (optional).</br>Official Store.</br>Ticket with guaranteed date and time.</br>INFORMATON ON THE VISIT:</br></br>On the day of the visit, go to the entrance of Tower B and show an electronic or printed copy of your ticket. </br>Due to the organisation of the Tour, scheduling and routes may change without prior notice.</br>Please be on time. Access for arrivals after the scheduled time is no guaranteed.</br>Your ticket is valid for one entry and will not be accepted for repeat entry attempts.</br>If you have a printed ticket, it must be intat and in good condition, as admission may be denied. Any ticket that seems to be modified, broken, in bad condition or showing signs of falsification, allows the management to deny your entry.</br>No refunds will be given. For reduced price tickets, the required verification documents will be asked for.</br>The management will not respond to the authenticity of any tickets bought outside the official points of sale and management is not responsible for such issues.</br>We are not able to provide storage facilities for any luggage, purshchairs or buggies on site due to security reasons.</br> No animals are allowed other than guide dogs.</br>There are several stairs and scalators on the Tour, so we do not recommend bringing luggage, pushchairs, strollers etc.</br>

name: Cruise Excursion: Avignon and Marseille Tour (MS36)
info: Tour 2 cities in southern France on this European adventure.</br> Walk the cobbled streets of beautiful Avignon before exploring the historic Notre-Dame de la Garde. </br></br>On this adventure you will… </br></br>Begin with a 90-minute scenic drive to the city of Avignon, where towers rise from a sea of pink tiles in this walled city on the Rhône River. </br>Walk through the narrow, cobbled streets as you take a 60-minute guided tour, including a visit of the Pope's Palace and learn about Avignon’s interesting history. </br>View the Pont d'Avignon, made famous by the eponymous children's song. In the heart of Avignon stands the abandoned fortified Palace of the Popes. Stroll through the deserted galleries, chambers and chapels of the palace. </br>Enjoy 75 minutes of free time to sample local cuisine and shop for souvenirs and provincial crafts. </br>Climb back aboard the motor coach for the 75-minute drive back to Marseille to visit the Notre-Dame de la Garde. The Basilica sits on a hill overlooking the city with a superb view of the Vieux Port. </br>Return to the pier.</br>

name: Cruise Excursion: Highlights of Milan (GN06)
info:
Explore the fashion capital of Italy and learn all about its history.

Venture Off to Milan

Experience art, fashion and more in this diverse Italian city.

On this adventure you will…

  • Begin with a 2 hour and 30-minute motor coach ride to Milan—considered the Italian industrial and commercial heart of the country. Its origins date back to 6th century B.C. although traces of earlier settlements have been found on the present site.
  • Isolated monuments left by these civilizations stand as witnesses to moments of glory and artistic splendor that have characterized the history of this city. Today, Milan is an important center of business, culture and politics whose suburban area is much industrialized. The fashion and design capital of Italy also has a city of art with a wealth of monuments, palaces, churches and museums.
  • Start your guided visit of Milan with a 30-minute panoramic drive through the main streets.
  • Continue with a short walk to the real heart of Milan, the Cathedral and Galleria Vittorio Emanuele.
  • Next, enjoy 1 hour and 45 minutes of free time to explore, shop or lunch on your own.
  • Re-board the motor coach for the 2 hour and 30-minute ride back to the pier.

name: Cruise Excursion: Discovering Florence (LV04)
info:
Explore the Piazza della Signoria, Santa Croce Square, and the most famous bridge in Florence, the Ponte Vecchio.Renaissance Spirit
After your walking tour of this artful city, enjoy some free time to shop, dine and sightsee on your own.

On this adventure you will…

  • Board your motorcoach and take a 2-hour scenic drive through Tuscany to Florence.
  • Upon your arrival in Florence, embark on a guided walking tour (wear comfortable walking shoes) of this age-old city. Today, the spirit of the Renaissance lives on in the Florentine streets, churches, museums and public squares. Note: this tour includes approximately 1.5 miles of walking at a steady pace, part of which will be on cobblestones and/or uphill.
  • While on your walking tour visit Piazza Santa Croce, a stunning square dominated by historic palaces and churches, and Piazza della Signoria, which features the majestic Old Palace and the famous Uffizi Gallery (external visit only).
  • Continue to the picturesque bridge, the Ponte Vecchio, and the Cathedral of S. Maria del Fiore and lastly, “The Gates of Paradise”, with the ornate baptistery doors sculpted by Ghiberti.
  • Note: Guests-including children-wishing to visit churches must ensure that shoulders and knees remain covered. You can wear shorts that reach below the knee and tank tops as long as you bring a sweater or scarf to wrap around your shoulders.
  • Afterward, enjoy 3 hours of free time to shop, sightsee through the ancient city, and enjoy lunch on your own.
  • Return to your motorcoach for your 1.5-hour return drive back to this ship.

name: Cruise Excursion: Naples Cityscape & Pompeii Walking Tour (NP81)
info:
Discover the magical cities of Naples and Pompeii, rich in history, traditions, art, and landscapes.

Naples Sightseeing

Experience Pompeii on a guided walking tour before heading back to Naples for a Cityscape Bus experience.

On this adventure you will…

  • Board your motorcoach for a 40-minute transfer to Pompeii..
  • Your experience will start with an approx. 90-minute guided walking tour through the ancient ruins of the city of Pompeii. Destroyed by a volcano eruption in AD 79 that encased the city in six meters of ash and pumice-stone, you’ll be immersed as you walk in the rich past of this stunning location.
  • Then, enjoy some free time in Pompeii to have lunch on your own—perhaps indulging in a classic Neapolitan pizza in the city where it was born.
  • Reboard your motorcoach for a return to Naples, where your Italian day will be followed by a panoramic tour of the city, taking in sights like Largo Castello, Piazza del Gesù, Piazza Dante, and more, as the city’s rich history and lively atmosphere unfold before your eyes.
  • Your day concludes with a smooth and comfortable transfer back to the port, leaving you with unforgettable memories of Pompeii and Naples.

name: Walks & Devour Tours. Premium Colosseum
Address: Via Delle Terme Di TITO, 72 (oppio cafe)
info:
Delve deep into ancient Roman history during this small-group tour of three of its most significant sites. Get ahead of the massive crowds at the Colosseum and explore the first and second tiers of the ancient arena as your guide brings Roman history to life. Climb to the top of Palatine Hill to wander through some of Rome’s oldest ruins and stroll through the Roman Forum, stopping at famous sights like the funeral pyre of Julius Caesar, the Arch of Constantine, and the Temple of the Vestal Virgins.

Sites visited:

Colosseum
Roman Forum
Palatine Hill
Included

Colosseum entrance ticket (24h – Colosseo/Foro Romano/Palatino Ticket €18)
Small group of 16 guests maximum
Expertly guided walking tour
Local English-speaking guide
Headset (groups over 6 people)

name: Walks & Devour Tours. Complete Vatican
Address: Antico Cafe Candia, Via Candia, 153 00192 Roma RM.
info:
The Complete Vatican Tour with Vatican Museums, Sistine Chapel & St. Peter’s Basilica
Highlights

  • Enjoy a complete Vatican tour and go beyond the expected, gaining deeper insight into its countless artistic and architectural treasures.
  • See the best of the Vatican Museums—from the Sistine Chapel to the Raphael Rooms and the Belvedere Courtyard—and explore St. Peter’s Basilica, home to Michelangelo’s Pietà and Bernini’s Baldachin.
  • Avoid often hours-long lines with skip-the-line access at both the Vatican Museums and St. Peter’s Basilica.
  • Relax in the company of a small group, making it easier for you to engage with our 5-star guides.


Sites visited
  • Vatican Museums
  • Sistine Chapel
  • St. Peter’s Basilica
  • St. Peter’s Square
  • Raphael Rooms
  • Apollo Belvedere & Laocoön & His Sons
  • Pinecone Courtyard
  • Gallery of the Candelabra
  • Gallery of the Maps
  • Gallery of the Tapestries


Included

  • Skip-the-line access to Vatican Museums
  • Skip-the-line access to St. Peter’s Basilica
  • Small group of 20 guests maximum
  • Local English-speaking guide
  • Expertly guided walking tour
  • Headset

name: Walks & Devour Tours. Catacombs and Appian Way
info:
Rome Underground: Catacombs at Closing Time, Appian Way & Aqueducts Tour

Highlights

  • Stroll along the Appian Way, one of the oldest roads in Rome.
  • Discover the grandeur of the Mausoleum of Cecilia Metella.
  • Stand beneath the towering remains of Rome’s ancient aqueducts.
  • Experience the Catacombs of San Sebastiano at closing time for an intimate visit.
  • Travel comfortably with private, air-conditioned transport.


Sites visited

  • Appian Way
  • Mausoleum of Cecilia Metella (exterior)
  • Ancient Roman Aqueducts
  • Catacombs of San Sebastiano


Included

  • Entry to the Catacombs of San Sebastiano
  • Transportation (minibus with air conditioning)
  • Small group of 18 guests maximum
  • Local English-speaking guide
  • Expertly guided walking tour
